qas.question: What does the acronym RLV stand for?
Which company originally developed and marketed the RLV?

answers.text: Optical Disc Corporation (ODC, now ODC Nimbus)

qas.question: In what year did ODC develop the Recordable LaserVision Disc?

context: Another form of recordable LaserDisc that is completely playback-compatible with the LaserDisc format (unlike CRVdisc with its caddy enclosure) is the RLV, or <a0_0>Recordable LaserVision disc<a0_0/>. It was developed and first marketed by the <a1_0>Optical Disc Corporation (ODC, now ODC Nimbus)<a1_0/> in <a2_0>1984.<a2_0/> RLV discs, like CRVdisc, are also a WORM technology, and function exactly like a CD-R disc. RLV discs look almost exactly like standard LaserDiscs, and can play in any standard LaserDisc player after they have been recorded.
